definition: lit. to strike water right and left (idiom)/fig. to turn everything into gold/to have everything going one's way/to benefit from both sides
surname Zuo
left/the Left (politics)/east/unorthodox/queer/wrong/differing/opposite/variant of 佐[zuo3]
right (-hand)/the Right (politics)/west (old)
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon
root/source/origin

sentences.english: But what makes good TV doesn't necessarily make for good teaching.
sentences.chinese: 然而做纪录片得心应手不代表必然能教课左右逢源。

sentences.english: The way kids learn to be resourceful is by having to use their resources.
sentences.chinese: 让孩子学会左右逢源的方法是让他们使用自己的资源。

sentences.english: Your communication skills will help you in rounding this person up -- and you refuse to let this one get away!
sentences.chinese: 交流技巧让你左右逢源，更不会轻易放走这个人。

sentences.english: Don't try to be all things to all people.
sentences.chinese: 不要想对所有人都左右逢源。

sentences.english: The Li bald astute extroversion, according to the circumstance, can achieve success one way or another in front of the reality.
sentences.chinese: 李光头精明外向，随机应变，在现实面前左右逢源。

definition: be smooth and slick (in establishing social relations)
long sleeves help one dance beautifully (idiom); money and power will help you in any occupation
like a fish back in water (idiom); glad to be back in one's proper surroundings
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
to be popular/to be getting on well/much in demand
free to come and go (idiom)/to have room to maneuver
to rapidly go up in the world/meteoric rise (of a career, social position etc)
two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
rising straight up in a clear sky (idiom); rapid promotion to a high post/meteoric career
(fig.) adaptable/able to deal with various kinds of people and situations/(derog.) insincere/two-faced
pinyin: jian4 ren2 shuo1 ren2 hua4 , jian4 gui3 shuo1 gui3 hua4
related.word: 见人说人话，见鬼说鬼话

definition: to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
a wise man looks after his own hide (idiom)/to put one's own safety before matters of principle
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
to win power/to get authority/to become dominant
